website_summaries.verdict: A good option that fits certain cars very well but won't fit in others.
pros: Anti-slip backing, no weird odors, and will last for life of your car
cons: Might not fit your vehicle and trimming is not recommended

customer_reviews.title: Contains lead!!
customer_reviews.text: From the product description on amazon: Made from only the highest quality of polymers, Motor Trend Mats are Odorless and Non-Toxic However, see the photo. These mats contain lead and come with a warning to wash hands after handling. I am returning immediately.
customer_reviews.author: LK

customer_reviews.title: Misinformation contain lead and harmful chemicals
customer_reviews.text: Misinformation, no where in the description states this product has lead and harmful chemicals, must wash hands after handling. The product is nice, but it would helped my decision if I knew it had harmful chemicals and lead. As a matter of fact, it states it's Eco friendly "100% odorless rubber ( eco friendly)" So is this product safe to keep in my truck with my grand children riding in it?
customer_reviews.author: Heritage03

customer_reviews.title: Awesome mats, front AND rear!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted nice rubber mats for my truck, but didn't want to pay the exorbitant amounts for 'custom fit' ones. I ordered these and love them! I have a 2015 F150 supercab and the rear mats fit PERFECT without any modifications. The front mats I had to trim off a bit, but now they look great, keep the floors underneath clean no matter how wet and gross my feet are, and are easy to wash out!
customer_reviews.author: 11Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit 2018 GMC Terrain, unless you cut way down and then it looks terrible!
customer_reviews.text: Spend the money for weathertech ones. At least you know those will fit right. Even when you cut them they do not fit properly. You have to actually cut past the designated cut sections to make them to kind of fit and then they just look terrible. The drivers one is completely unsafe. Moves around, and does not fit at all. Took it out immediately. Decided I couldn't live with the other ones either and took them out too. All around cheap and useless product.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa L. Babcock

customer_reviews.title: A little trim and perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: I'm still having a hard time believing these were only $40. They almost fit my 2013 f150 xlt super cab perfectly. I did have to slightly trim the drivers side, trimmed a lot off the passenger side and the rear needed a little trim. Took 5 minutes to trim all the mats. They fit great now. Look amazing and I couldn't be happier. I'd buy again if these ever wear out.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler C.

customer_reviews.title: Great for all climate types
customer_reviews.text: I drive a 2014 Nissan Rogue Select. I live in upstate New York. I deal with with every kind of weather and these floor mats do the trick. They're nice and deep, flexible, DONT SMELL LIKE DILDOS. Highly recommend. I would buy this again. I did have to alter the back seat floor mats, that is expected though when you purchase universal SUV floor mats
customer_reviews.author: Pinkster

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend
customer_reviews.text: Do not recommend. I bought this for my Infiniti Q50. It said it fits my vehicle but none of them did. Pathetic. I have already cut them trying to fit it but it just doesn't. I have already cut them so I'm not sure if it qualifies for return.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too Flexible
customer_reviews.text: These mats are actually too flexible and will not stay in place and the edges and corners will easily flip. These mats would be great if they were more rigid as they are heavy enough. I simply cannot tolerate a floor mat that can easily flip and cannot stay in place as it defeats the purpose of having them.
customer_reviews.author: Norman D Smith

customer_reviews.title: LEAD!!
customer_reviews.text: Mats came fast and look as described. Front needed a little trimming for my 2019 ram but the rear fits well no trimming. Unfortunately after installation and fully reading the paperwork and packaging...it says the floor mats contain lead? Which is a known carcinogen in the state of California (and let’s be honest, everywhere else too except maybe Russia-they don’t admit anything!). I am debating wether or not I will keep them in my truck or if the manufacturer will do anything about this. It’s a shame because they are a good value but I guess you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: DONT BUY WASTE OF MONEY
customer_reviews.text: Horrible horrible. These stated they would fit a 2013 Buick Encore. I opened them up to find the back mat it about a foot too long and the center area is about a foot too wide. I ended up cutting all the surrounding area and cutting the center out due to the fit being so horrid. I have so much material left over the manufacturer could have made three. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: DR350Rider

customer_reviews.title: They worked see review.Great price
customer_reviews.text: I did not trim the front 2 mats because I would of had to trim into the deep well lucky my gas pedal has protection that kept mat from interfering.The rear 1 piece mat I cut and trimmed to make 2 separate rear mats.You should try and check all mats front & rear if they will work without any trimming if they work that might be best.2017 Hyundai Tucson
customer_reviews.author: marty70442

customer_reviews.title: Best one out!!
customer_reviews.text: I have had all of the rug mats from cheap to Car specific expensive ones. These are better them all of them. They are made very well and appear to trap all debris and liquids if u have kids like I do. I used this for an 05 tahoe and the quality is great and it doesn’t move at all. U will need to cut it to get the ultimate perfect fit and I believe it will keep the carpet clean in any place u put it. Great buy!!
customer_reviews.author: Steven P Nelson

customer_reviews.title: great but its a heave material my hans could never ...
customer_reviews.text: The mats them selfs are awsome, however not even clise to a fit, they say trim trim fit, great but its a heave material my hans could never cut all thesr mats , and ro fit the vehicle I requested id have to cur them so small they woukd not have the big lip to hold stuff off off the carpet. Why ask what vehicle and year if tou are just sending a generic mat rhst i need to fibd a way to make fit. An overwhelming job to say the least
customer_reviews.author: brentwoodkat

customer_reviews.title: Worth the wait! Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: These mats are awesome! The quality is great and make my car look nice plus protects the carpet. Take time when trimming them and they will fit perfect in an 8th generation Honda Civic sedan. Thank you seller/Amazon! The mats were delivered a few days later than estimated but totally worth it. I even bought a set for my best friends truck as a gift and he really likes the product.
customer_reviews.author: Angel n Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Contains Lead, flimsy and don't fit.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my 2020 Ram and they don't fit. The back piece is too short and the front mats are way too big and even after trimming, they don't fit right. Also a note to anyone interested in buying these: THEY CONTAIN LEAD! Don't allow a pregnant woman or child to touch them and wash your hands thoroughly after touching them! I have NO idea why Amazon, or the U.S. would allow the sale of a lead product after we know what it does, but apparently they do. They are really flimsy too, which is weird because they are thick. I would recommend you look elsewhere for a better floor mat.
customer_reviews.author: Beeswax

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Regarding the folks who complained about the fit in the back, their pics show they didn’t cut to separate the “third piece” into two floor mats lol Make sure to do that and it’s fine! I was worried these would be too difficult to cut since my drivers side mat in particular has an odd shape, but I actually just used a small cheap pocketknife and it was so simple & effortless to cut, and it didn’t leave a choppy sad looking edge but cut thru so well that everything was very smooth. Great mats, they don’t move around and they have no odor at all. Highly recommend these!
customer_reviews.author: kilebo

customer_reviews.title: Try to fit in Tucson 2014
customer_reviews.text: This mats DO NOT fit Tucson 2014, despite much trimming. The mat is too long for the driver side even after cutting. The front passenger side can fit okay. The entire middle section of the rear mat has to be cut off since it's too wide for the Tucson. Ironically, it'd fit my Sienna 2009 2nd-row floor (in case someone is looking for that). For the price, it's okay quality wise. Easy to cut. I can make do with it for now through this winter. Then I may go for the OEM Tucson mat after all.
customer_reviews.author: Que Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: I do like how they look. I do not like the thickness or even the quality really. They are kind of like the cheep floor mats that you would get from AutoZone. Not saying AutoZone doesn’t have great mats, but that they also have some low priced pieces in which these mats would probably be with. They are just too thin and light weight. If you have big snowy boots on, the mat won’t hold the water in the rubber because the boots will disfigure the rubber and water will spill out on the carpet. This has been my experience and I wouldn’t buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The floor mat that protects!
customer_reviews.text: I liked these so well I bought a second set for our other new vehicle. Only downside is, the second set has a somewhat strong chemical odor after the vehicle has been closed up for a couple days. I just spray them and the car down with some freshener and it's good to go. I'm still very pleased with my purchase. Would do it again!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Not great. It does not fit (as claimed)
customer_reviews.text: Not great. It does not fit (as claimed). You basically have to cut away 60% if the mat for it to fit (sort of). My car has knobs on the floor board and that doesn’t work with these at all. So for the money ok but it doesn’t really fit so boo.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Baldwin

customer_reviews.title: Slips around
customer_reviews.text: I really like these car mats, but they slip around my car especially with children in the back seat. The ad said that they will fit my car, but even with cutting them appropriately to fit, it still doesn’t work out that great. I like it because they keep the dirt off the carpet underneath, but can get stained easily and even with scrubbing them, they have a dirt stain. It’s all dirt where I live, so maybe it wasn’t meant for that much dirt.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: It can be cut to fit but slides around
customer_reviews.text: For the money, the versatility by cutting to fit is good but there is no grip on the bottom side so, even though the fit is good, the mat has no grip on the bottom side so it will slip around on the carpet of the car. It is soft and flexible so it will bend and squeeze, not stiff enough to fit tightly on the floor. As for waterproof, it is a rubber mat so it will retain moisture. I just wish it had some spikes or velcro hooks to grab on the floor carpet so it will not move around.
customer_reviews.author: Inkspot

customer_reviews.title: They don't fit all trucks
customer_reviews.text: It has very nice cutaway pieces. The problem is they are still way to big for a Nissan Frontier (and probably Takomas, Rangers, etc...). I was able to cot the back crew cab without it looking too bad. But the front two look awful. Hopefully, they will do all right for what I got them for: keeping the mud and snow off the carpet. By the way they feel, I will have to replace the driver's side by next year. Disappointed, but a good price.
customer_reviews.author: StinkyB

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Front mats fit perfectly in the 2017 Honda Accord LX back mat needed a small adjustment which cut off with a regular house scissor Easy as pie Love these new mats No odor and very stylish. Easy to clean and durable. Motor trend was spot on!
customer_reviews.author: Bklyngal

customer_reviews.title: Not a perfect fit.
customer_reviews.text: The quality is pretty decent (they’re not hard plastic, rather they’re quite flexible), but I couldn’t figure out how to make them fit perfectly even with trimming them down, and I ordered these because it was confirmed to fit my vehicle (2016 Chevy Sonic). The back seat pieces I had to completely cut up and then push the middle piece under the other ones, because it was too wide and also didn’t fit the gap well. The front seat ones didn’t need trimming at all, which was nice.
customer_reviews.author: Jena

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: I'm always jealous of the people that shell out the $250 for perfectly fit hard mats from the dealership, but I can't justify that cost:( I will say that it's kind of annoying that you have to cut the mats to fit your vehicle perfectly, & in both cars I've purchased this for, the back mat has never fit just right. (Meaning I've had to have 2 small mats in the back rather than 1 that runs all the way across.) That being said, this product saves the floor of my car during the winter months with all the ice, salt, mud, etc. that I would track into in otherwise. Overall, I'm very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Affordable Vehicle Floor Mats
customer_reviews.text: Product (Motor Trend MT-923-BK Black FlexTough Contour Liners-Deep Dish Heavy Duty Rubber Floor Mats for Car SUV Truck & Van-All Weather Protection) I purchased these to replace the carpet floor mats that were in my 2001 Dodge Dakota. The front driver and passenger side mats fit without having to be trimmed. The rear mat had to be trimmed for the back and that was no issue. Overall extremely happy with this purchase. I know some reviews pointed out the warning about being exposed to lead and smells with these mats but I am not overly concerned about this. As I washed the mats down before placing in the vehicle and washed my hands after handling.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Item
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect, but the design doesn't quite mold to the PS front. No matter how you cut them, if there's no absolute "Does Fit Vehicle", there will be a very slight buckle. Other than that, they are Awesome! Especially for the money. Made of a good quality rubber and they Do Not Slip! There is a rubber odor for a couple of days, but what do you expect? It's gone in a couple of days.
customer_reviews.author: Bam Bam

customer_reviews.title: The juice is worth the squeeze with these :)
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I’ve ordered floor mats from this company and I am beyond impressed. Durable, not too thin, and they hold up really well. I wanted to order the custom fit ones but these are the next best thing for a fraction of the price! Spill an entire tea because you’re driving like Ricky Bobby? No problem, these mats got your back! Pick up a mountain man with muddy boots? Spray them bad boys off and Bam good as new! Received quickly and packaged well! A++
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra Thornton

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat the price ,well made
customer_reviews.text: These fit my 2011 Honda Crv pretty good. I had to trim a little on passenger side and for the back seat mates. It was easy to trim and for the price I didn't mind. Looked at several others and these were better priced. Nice when you can just lift out to dump rocks etc.and keeps carpet clean from rain,mud. These will be great for winter. I'm going to order a set for my Jeep Liberty. I would highly recommend. Oh yeah my fiance likes them so I'll buy her a set for her Honda Accord.
customer_reviews.author: Allen Shoemaker

customer_reviews.title: Great for messy winters
customer_reviews.text: These cut to fit easily. I cut them a bit larger to fit full over my other cloth mats. The only problem is that they don't have a way to stay in place. They slide up a couple of inches under the clutch petal. So, every few times in and out of the car you have to pull them back towards the driver seat. I'm using them in a 2013 Fiat 500 Pop. They would fit in all sorts of vehicles. Small like the Fiat or up to a truck size.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: More Chinese misrepresented, toxic, and dangerous  junk.
customer_reviews.text: Contains toxins, don't fit a 2011 Hyundai Elantra Touring as represented, and dubious whether they are even safe to place on the floor of the car without sliding and becoming a braking/accelerating control hazard or if they will protect the interior flooring to begin with. What's to like about these? Nothing! Next time I'm going to buy Weather Tech, MADE IN U.S.A.!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Randall Miller

customer_reviews.title: Cheap/Strange Design
customer_reviews.text: Will they keep dirt off underlying carpet? When they don't move around, yes. Rubber is cheap/thin - but easy to cut. It has a raised edge on ends which is good to hold dirt, but not great when moving your feet about because they'll "snag". Costco/O'Reilly had better ones for similar price. These happened to have the width I needed. If I hadn't cut them to size, I'd return. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Marcos Estebez

customer_reviews.title: Manufacturing defect ignored
customer_reviews.text: These are fairly nice floormats. Unfortunately one arrived with a hole torn in the center of the mat. This was not shipping damage as product was very well packaged and the packaging was not damaged. I contacted the manufacturer upon delivery two times and was ignored. A flyer in the package asked that the supplier should not be contacted for defects and that Motor Trend was to be contacted instead and they would make good on the part. Looks to be a quality control problem and poor customer service. If you have a problem with yours you can save some time and get much better service by contacting Amazon instead.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. S---the teacher

customer_reviews.title: Not a Good Fit
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for a 2019 Ford Ranger. After cutting away almost all of the cut areas these mats do not fit. Particularly the front driver side. Had to cut away the center bridge on the rear mats to get them in place. This shows up as a product that suitable for the Ranger but I can attest that is not the case. I sent a message to the seller but - no response. I like the concept of cut-to-fit but I expectant them to fit after I finish hacking away. I also like the deep foot well. I would have to cut beyond the well the get this to fall into place.
customer_reviews.author: Blissfully Booked

customer_reviews.title: so easy to customize
customer_reviews.text: I just took 20 minutes to customize my new floor mats to my 2011 Hyundai Sonata and couldn't be happier. I spent over $100 on Weather Techs for my last car which was supposed to be laser fitted and wasn't. I can tell you I got a better fit with my box cutter and a pair of scissors for $33.00. Where I park for work is a wet, gravely parking lot, and my carpeted floor matts were getting really beat up. Now with my new matts, I have no worries about getting into my car with wet boots anymore. Highly recommended. Not very thick, but just what I needed to preserve my original floor matts.
customer_reviews.author: Howard Land

customer_reviews.title: They're not great but will work
customer_reviews.text: I should be clear I knew what these were when I bought them. However I'm still disappointed. Even with the cut to fit they don't fit great. I also do kot care for their looks. $30 is a fair price, just keep in mind they do not compare to weathertech or factory. Priced accordingly. They'll work but I don't love them. These are the same pretty much and the price is more in line with what they are. AmazonBasics 3-Piece All-Season Odorless Heavy Duty Rubber Floor Mat for Cars, SUVs and Trucks, Gray
customer_reviews.author: skillet34

customer_reviews.title: No trimming guide included
customer_reviews.text: This is a universal mat designed to fit multiple car makes and models. This manufacturer confirms this will work for my car (which we must give them the benefit of the doubt that they tested.) But when you get the item there is no guide as to how to make it fit. Basically, it's up to you do so, and it's way easier to do it WRONG than to do it RIGHT! So, buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Fits 2016 Mustang GT - cheapest price anywhere on the internet
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my 2016 Mustang GT because I didn't want to spend 200 dollars on floor mats. Just and cut to size and place it in. The rear set was a bit too large so even with trimming doesn't quite fit - bottom area in the back of the Mustang is really small - but it does the job and rear seat passengers are few and far between. The front set went in great
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the 2011 Equinox
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for the 2011 Chevy Equinox and they fit perfectly, didn't have to trim anything off the front ones at all. The back one only had to trim off the outer tabs with the holes for hanging in a store and then just had to cut the center piece from the two outer pieces and place them overlapping the center piece in the car. Hope that made sense and will try to post a photo later.
customer_reviews.author: Rosie

customer_reviews.title: These provide wonderful protection fr my Ram truck in the Michigan winters
customer_reviews.text: These provide wonderful protection fr my Ram truck in the Michigan winters. The "well" is nice and deep and ill a good amount of snow-melt and dirt. The nicest thing is how soft they were, very easy to cut to fit using normal scissors. They're made in China, so if you want American made get the Husky or Weathertech brand, just know it's 3x the price. I get why some would do that and I still might down the road, but for me right now these were in my budget and I'll be good as long as they last without ripping or tearing them.
customer_reviews.author: Curt Brackenrich

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean!!!
customer_reviews.text: I had cloth mats in my car for the longest time I finally got rid of them when they became too gross and replaced them with these and I must say I love these so much more I wish I would have bought them sooner. They’re so easy to clean, I can wipe them down or spray them down with the hose they’re durable and a great price
customer_reviews.author: Marina

customer_reviews.title: Great Deal
customer_reviews.text: My Nissan came with some really nice custom carpet mats but I needed something that I could clean easy. I order these just before it started raining and I'm so happy I did. These have raised edges so water can't run off onto the floor. When I clean the car they're easy to wipe off. You will have to trim these to fit but that's to be expected. The piece for the backseat is one piece. I had to separate it into to have 2 mats because I have a small car. No strong chemical order. I'm really glad I got them. I highly recommend them. I paid under $30.00. Way cheaper than customer mats.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle D. Turner

customer_reviews.title: Not For Subcompact
customer_reviews.text: The product seems to be durable. But the problem is the size, at least for my subcompact car. I have a Yaris hatchback and even if you trim the maximum amount of the edges and just leave the deep-dish part, it still is quite big. I forgot to take a pic of the Back mats But I had to separate them from the middle part and add the middle part and trim it a lot to make it “fit”. I think the quality is good and the looks but too bad that it is kinda expensive for mats that I had to literally trim like 78% or more of the whole set in total to make them fit.
customer_reviews.author: rluise

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded all expectations
customer_reviews.text: We have a Scion tC with 200k+ miles, purchased new, and have tried to take good care of it. The old black rubber mats I bought to protect the carpet were shot. I wanted to purchase WeatherTech floor liners, but they no longer make/sell mats for a 15 year old Scion. I reluctantly ordered these as they are wider than most trimmable mats, and have a very pronounced "deep dish" design to hold water. They are amazingly sturdy and easily trimmable. My wife was disappointed when I told her "no WeatherTechs", but is THRILLED with these very inexpensive Motor Trend mats. We love 'em!
customer_reviews.author: R. Albright

customer_reviews.title: 2011 Ford F150 - Fits like a glove.
customer_reviews.text: I picked these up to save a bit of money versus buying the more expensive brand that are fitted. I'm pretty happy with these. Get yourself some scissors and put the mat down so you can cut the pieces too large off the mat. These haven't torn or worn out. I've had them almost a year. Holds water well. Very easy to fold and remove. My driver side mat will slide towards the door. I need to put something down under it to keep it in place. There are no holes to attach it to your floor mat bolt. Overall if you need to save money and need some quality mats these are the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Martin

customer_reviews.title: Quality is good, Fitment is terrible
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product because it says it would fit a 2012 Accord Coupe and winter is coming. Cut the mats as closely as possible to the floor plan but did NOT fit at all. A chunk of the mat is laying on top of the driver's foot rest and my gas door release handle. I can see this being durable, but the fitment is just terrible. I'd be keeping this mat until winter is over and I might consider getting a fitted Accord mats. I can't say the same will happen to every car, but just FYI for potential 8th Gen Accord owner.
customer_reviews.author: Zano Korellio

customer_reviews.title: Quite nice for the price paid
customer_reviews.text: Fits very well (after trimming), in our 2012 Ford Expedition. No fitting required for second row, no fitting for drivers side floor but, a decent amount of fitting required for passenger side floor. If you can use a razor knife or sharp scissors, you'll have no problem making these mats fit well and look very nice. They've only been installed about a week so I can't say anything as to their longevity, here's hoping they last long enough to justify the purchase. t
customer_reviews.author: Tyler D

customer_reviews.title: Not the perfect fit— but still great
customer_reviews.text: I really like the mats... if they fit exactly. I decided to get the mats because I input my car information and it showed a “perfect fit” on amazon. I had to cut the mats to fit better which was fine- I figured I would have to , but the mats shouldn’t have a piece of the mat that is creased Up on the side even after being cut. The back seat mats don’t fit flush to the floor of the car, the sides hit the base of the seat and don’t fit right making it easy for the mats to easily move
customer_reviews.author: Imarth

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Put these in a 2020 Honda CR-V. I had the carpet floormats already, so was a bit easier to trim these rubber mats, using the carpeted ones as a template. Back seat and passenger seat had some minor trimming. The driver's seat needed a bit more, to accommodate the dead pedal, so I lost the spill proof ledge in the trimming...though I think the more expensive and oem mats have that piece missing too. Good mats over all, especially for $30, which is about 65% less the more expensive ones.
customer_reviews.author: AntJustAnt

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for snow a slush
customer_reviews.text: We live in Michigan so we wanted a mat that would hold the snow and not just melt and leak around and into the carpet. I read the reviews and knew these were on the low end of the scale but they did have that depression that we need. I especially like the bad reviews that compare them to the $500 dollar ones :). Oh well. I trimmed them for my Dodge 1500 and they work great. My wife said she wanted a set so I got the ones for her truck. They fit even better. For $30 I cannot see an issue with them so, yes I would recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Crandall

customer_reviews.title: Never again
customer_reviews.text: I have never given a 1-star rating before even though some things I've ordered in the past were sub-par. These floor mats are a joke. Flimsy and certainly don't fit what vehicle they said they would. Problem is, you have no idea if they're going to fit until you cut them to "fit". They're not much better than wet cardboard. Do yourself a favor, pay the extra money, and get what you know is going to work. What a waste of cash, obviously Motortrend needs the money more than I do...
customer_reviews.author: Joe Radkins

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit a 2003 Tacoma
customer_reviews.text: The standard mats for the truck don't even come close to these cut-to-fit that cannot fit. They are also too expensive for very flimsy and floppy material. I have seen notes here that it has lead? Seriously? Health hazard!! I will monitor the odd smell. They smell like a tire shop. Motor Trend. Of all the things you put your name on, this was a complete disappointment. Please don't buy for older Trucks and SUV's! I hate to say it but a complete loss and wasted money.
customer_reviews.author: Irl Green

customer_reviews.title: Cleats on bottom do not hold mats in place, slide around floor board too much
customer_reviews.text: For the money these are a decent alternative to custom mats. I found them easy to trim with a nice pair of scissors. The look and feel decent. As others have mentioned they are a little thinner / lighter than I expected. The look decent as well once in place. My only real complaint is the cleats on the bottom are very small. They slide around excessively when getting in and out of the car. The get pushed all over the place and look sloppy. I have to re-position them every time I get into or out of the car.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.text: The floor mats are amazing! Although they did not actually “fit” my car I cut the areas I needed in order for it to fit rather than complaining over a durable set of weathered mats that cost under $30. I work in a dirt filled area and after a rainy day my mats are usually destroyed and hard to clean; but these Motor Trend mats were easy to clean and actually fitted for my floorboard so no dirt on my carpet! The car these mats went into is a 2012 Hyundai Elantra I would definitely recommend these hassle free to clean mats to everyone!!
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for heavy duty floor mat for my car and this one seems to be the best so far. It came right on time with securely packed. I live in a state where we get a lot of snow ,so I needed something that can last quit long time. It fit my car perfectly and if you needed adjustment it is easy to cut. Anyone who is looking for floor mat I highly recommend this heavy duty floor mat.
customer_reviews.author: Munkh

customer_reviews.title: Not a good fit
customer_reviews.text: Bought for Subaru Forester, was suppose to fit, I guess you could say they fit just not very good. Even cutting them ( the front) left them a little to big in places but if I took more off they wouldn’t serve the purpose they were intended for. The back wasn’t right so the center had to be cut out which kind of defeated the purpose since I wanted to cover the hump. Be aware even though it says it will fit it may not fit very well. But it will serve its purpose for now.
customer_reviews.author: Star

customer_reviews.title: Details Aren't Accurate
customer_reviews.text: I liked that the material is great and easy to clean, however, when purchasing it stated that these mats would fit my vehicle. They do not fit my vehicle at all, especially my backseat ones. They do not stay in place, they're always moving or bunches up.The details states product is odorless and it very much has a strong smell to it. The trim is easy to cut, but still even after cutting it doesnt properly fit vehicle, you end up cutting most of the mat making it a useless purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Joshcelynne Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: I love these floor matts. These are super sturdy and well made for what you're paying for. Seriously, you can't beat the price. It required a little trimming for my chevy equinox but it wasn't hard. I'm from Michigan and we get alot of snow , these keep the water from soaking into my interior. I've seen a few reviews complaining about the odor but I wouldn't expect a factory made rubber to smell any more pleasant. And the odor dissipates eventually. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Brianna

customer_reviews.title: Larger to cover more carpet area in front seat. Fits a Chrysler Town and Country well!
customer_reviews.text: Much wider than the standard mats you buy at Sam’s Club or the hardware store. They seem to be heavy duty and very nice quality. The tray lip isn’t as deep as others I’ve had in the past, but is sufficient. I loved that they didn’t have a strong odor and were shipped in a nice large box. Having the joined back rugs is super handy and covers lots surface area than the standard squares. I drive a Chrysler Town and Country and they cover nearly every bit of carpet in the drivers and passenger areas.
customer_reviews.author: sagen'jade

customer_reviews.title: Not an exact fit
customer_reviews.text: I literally searched for things that were an exact fit to the year make model of my vehicle which is a full size vehicle not a rare one just a full size so you think you would get big mats well let me tell you these mats or so huge they would be too big for the peterbilt truck I have These mats are enormous ridiculous I spent 45 minutes trimming them not my idea of a good time I just wanted to buy mats that were an exact fit that you throw in the car
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Nissan rogue sport 2020...
customer_reviews.text: I did minor trimming for the front seat which fit exceptionally well. The back seat needed some major trimming and tucking and pulling and squishing eventually getting a mediocre fit, not great but acceptable especially for the price. If you are looking for a perfect fit in a rogue sport 2020 this is not it. For me its doable I honestly just aim to protect my lease so I dont get charged for damages in the end. These will do a good enough job.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wish they made a Roadkill edition. Rubber stinks and states it contains lead.
customer_reviews.text: Would be cool if they made a Roadkill edition, but motortrend is cool. Roadkills logo would look good on these mats. Mats are good, thick rubber, easy to clean, & protect nicely. The rubber stinks strong and contains lead & other cancer causing prop#65 CA warning. Would be nice if they weren’t toxic
customer_reviews.author: Ramble Tamble

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: I purchases these thinking they would be like Weather Tech floor mats, boy was I wrong, I should have read the description a bit more carefully as you have to cut these to fit, I have a very small SUV and even after cutting them as small as they could go they were still awkward and didn't fit right. The only reason I gave it 2 stars was because they are extremely heavy duty rubber and they were deeper than your average mat so they will hold water, snow etc... If you have a large truck or lots of space these mats would be fine but otherwise I wasted my money. Live and learn.
customer_reviews.author: April Grillo

customer_reviews.title: Thin, flimsy material.
customer_reviews.text: I don't think durability was a design criterion. Some kind of supple, rubber foaminess, like a sneaker insole. The ones in my old truck (and transplanted to the new) are thick, hard rubber, 17-18 years old, and still almost undamaged. I did wear a hole in the drivers side mat with my heel, working the clutch. These things aren't even close. I kept them, telling myself they might keep the carpet in the car nice, but honestly, the sides are so flexible and shallow I doubt they will even contain a spill. And the rear ones are small, just big enough for two feet side-by-side.
customer_reviews.author: Art Buckler

customer_reviews.title: Easy to cut, easy to clean, and a bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pair of these mats I order. The first ones were 2 years ago in my actual car which are still in excellent condition. These mats protect my car from snow, mud, sand, and some other weather issues oh and my dog! I had to order my boyfriend a pair as well! Now it’s his turn to know that you don’t have to order car mats that cost over $100 that give you what you want! Background information- 2015 Mitsubishi outlander sport & Subaru Outback 2014
customer_reviews.author: Laura Diaz

customer_reviews.title: You can cut to size!
customer_reviews.text: I looked at the weather tech mats but they are pricey. I saw these and decided to give them a try. These are great. I already have had a few rains, beach runs and driving the kids around daily, these mats hold up well. I was able to cut these to fit my 2012 Mazda 6. So if you're looking for some good protection for your car and if you got kids, get these. The fact that you can cut them to size makes them very useful.
customer_reviews.author: Stugi

customer_reviews.title: Excellent - universal fit all mats
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for a 2020 Chevy Spark. There are patterns all around the main deep well of these mats, simply a matter of using an exacto knife (or scissors) and cutting out the sections of the patterns from the outer edges to accommodate indents for seat tracks and other items down in the wells of the car front and back. I cut out the patterns where needed... perfect fit. Good solid quality, should get a lot of good years out of these.
customer_reviews.author: C. Vendel

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this purchase. I have an older Hondai Sonata. The product is durable, heavy. If cut right, it will definitely stay in place. I did very minimal cutting. My interior is a light gray, so I wanted as much coverage as possible, but I also am happy that it looks good. I kept the back piece/ mats as one (I did not cut to separate the mats) and the reach over the hump back there is just right. Again, I only made a few adjustments and this is just perfect. Looks very easy to clean. Could get away with rinsing, sweeping, or dusting off these mats.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: The floor mats are good quality and after using them for a few months they will be sure to last years. The rubber is think and flexible and being able to adjust and cut the floor mat is nice. The only issue I have is that they slide around more than I’d like. At least once every other trip in my vehicle I have to adjust the floor mat. So If you get this set you might want to get something to help it stay. For the price though the value is really good and I’m very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Sam F

customer_reviews.title: Must have!
customer_reviews.text: These are so nice with having little kids in the car and their snacks makes cleaning the car much easier!
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Easy trim-to-fit and easy to clean.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for a 2008 Toyota Tacoma double cab and they were easy to trim for a good fit. Like lots of "new" things, they had an unpleasant odor for a few days, but that seems to be a very temporary issue. They are nice looking and easy to clean, but only time will tell on durability. My wife was not sure she'd like the "feel" of these mats, as she likes to be barefoot, but she says they're okay, relatively soft and smooth to the touch.
customer_reviews.author: KERRY C

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: I guess for the price I should not complain, but the fit of these in my vehicle - which Amazon says these will fit - is approximate at best. I had to cut outside the lines in a couple of places to prevent corners from sticking up excessively. They feel like they will not be very durable, the rubber is excessively soft. But whatever - we'll see how these last, but when it's time to replace them I'll be getting something else.
customer_reviews.author: Capt Kirk

customer_reviews.title: A lot of trimming required
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for my Silverado and while they worked, a lot of trimming was required to make them fit. I had to completely remove the center of the back seat floor mat to fit my pickup. Aside from that I have found that the raised lip is weaker than i would prefer and I have concerns that this may be a problem in the future. But these will work until i find the mats I want that will fit the truck. For the price, they are a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Stan

customer_reviews.title: Not a rugged and tough kinda mat.
customer_reviews.text: The mats are too flimsy. The kind that will eventually roll away from where they are supposed to be. The spike beads that go your car's carpet are small and beady. Not strong at all. I could roll these up into a small roll no problem. These are listed as deep dish but if you step onto the dished area then your kids koolaid will roll right out. Too flimsy. If you are looking for tough and rugged than do not buy these.
customer_reviews.author: Enrique Arredondo

customer_reviews.title: ANGRYYYYYYYYY
customer_reviews.text: Had to cut all of the mats down to the smallest dimension size and still does not fit our Audi. Very UNHAPPY with Product and how it said it matched my Audi
customer_reviews.author: Raiden R.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit 2004 Ram like it says.
customer_reviews.text: Ok, I totally get the fact that you have to cut them to get a precise fit so that's not the problem. The problem is in the club cab part (The long strip mat) is way too short, about 6" or more short from door to door. The quality is not what I expected too, the ridges that are supposed to hold the sand/dirt/mud etc are so flexible the squish down. I unboxed these tried to get them to fit and walked right back in and packed them back up to return. I really wanted them to fit but these are a no go.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Fit and Fitment
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for a 2003 Toyota Tacoma. With a lot of chopping it fits nice. The back mad had to be cut into 2 pieces. It was much too long to fit back there without the middle creating a hump. Plus the back seat has under the seat cup holders. Keeping it solid would not allow you to use that cub holder. Having it in 2 pieces is not an issue. Once is was trimmed it fit real nice. Should keep things clean for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Gary E. Hays

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: While not laser measured to fit, they also are not $150. For less than 25% of the cost of competitors, I found these weather matts to be easy to cut to fit. The manufacturer has molded in guide lines that allow you to easily trim the matts to fit. The water, mud capture zones are well positioned, high enough to hold the mess and yet not intrusive to the operation of the vehicle. I think these are a super value.
customer_reviews.author: grit

customer_reviews.title: Good product, bad description
customer_reviews.text: First things first -- the mats are pretty well made and allow for many customizations. That being said, the listing advertised those as being compatible with my 2016 Mazda CX-9. They are not -- front mat, on the driver side, partially covers acceleration pedal, and foot rest on the lest, even with all the "optional" parts being cut away. Rear mat, while bulging a bit in the middle, and not covering much area under the front seats, fits reasonably well. To reiterate, the mats would receive a 4 or 5 star review -- *if* they fit as advertised. Not sure who's at fault here -- Amazon, the seller, or manufacturer, but someone messed up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Bought for my wife's KIA Rodeo
customer_reviews.text: Fit pretty well, not as well as advertised (as our SUV was on the list of vehicles that they were supposed to fit) but I guess fit is a relative term. It took a fair amount of clipping and trimming to get them close but, once finished, they do a good job at protecting the carpet and cost a lot less than those custom made, name brand, mats. If you're on a budget I would get these in a heartbeat. They're well made from heavy gauge material and get the job done, for a reasonable price, as long as you don't mind taking the time and trimming them correctly.
customer_reviews.author: W. Lockridge

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Really good quality, easy to clean off grass and dirt. They are a bit too big for my Nissan truck but nothing that can not be fixed. They do the job of keeping my truck clean from dirt and grass so I am happy.
customer_reviews.author: 🍦🍹WR🍹🍦

customer_reviews.title: not a hard plastic surface.
customer_reviews.text: These floor mats really aren't "heavy duty", but they are pretty good for the money. More of a medium weight, but very, very flexible, easy to trim and lay nicely. The surface of these mats is fairly porus and they tend to hold dirt. It wasn't long before they had permanent stains that wouldn't wash out where your heels and feet rest. They are serviceable, but they probably won't stay pretty long.
customer_reviews.author: Waddie

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: After a few weeks of using I have rated this product 4 stars. For the price, it's very compatible. Cutting all four mats are easy, you must take good measurements. I have a 2018 Ford Focus I bought this for since I bought it without mats. I cut 4 different pieces and it seems that it fits great. The only issues I've seen so far is that they don't stay in place if you have a lot of activity. Overall for the price it's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price
customer_reviews.text: Decent for the price. Holds tension well against floor board carpets. The ridges or rings you see in the pictures are the areas on the mat that begin to contour up to form a bucket shape. The bucket shaped contour provides a good area for catching all kinds of crap. If you have a second row with little floor space, don't waste your time with rear mats. The inner square you see in the picture is where the rear mats begin to form their bucket shape, roughly 10x12. If you have floor space smaller than the mentioned dimensions, the rear mats will not fit. I have a 2013 mini cooper s and I definitely did not measure the second row.
customer_reviews.author: aj

customer_reviews.title: 2020 Hyundai Elentra- Did not fit as said.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a 2020 Hyundai Elentra Heavy Duty Rubber Floor Mat. 1.Only the front passenger floor mat fits perfectly. 2.Everything else was unfit. I had to use scissors to cut and resize them to fit in. 3.There is no hook to hold the mats stable. It keeps on slipping from its place. In the end its not worth it. I would have returned it but unfortunately, due to poor decisions, I already had resized it.
customer_reviews.author: ashim

customer_reviews.title: Best, Most Comfortable floor mats ever!
customer_reviews.text: After having a set of these in my 2007 Nissan Altima and loving them I decided to purchase another set for my dad's 2008 Subaru Forester except this time without the trunk liner, as he already has one. Once trimmed down (Which took only a few minutes) they fit into both cars perfectly. They are aesthetically pleasing, comfortable underneath your feet, and very easy to clean on top of keeping your car clean in general. Love them, absolutely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Size really does matter!
customer_reviews.text: Extremely disappointed in this purchase. I specifically selected my vehicle to ensure that I had the correct size, and as evidence by the photos clearly it does not fit my vehicle. Further the driver side covers the left leg rest. I will probably remove the driver side so it’s not to impact my gas or brake pedal. This is a bummer I really liked the color of these for my new car and I’m extremely bummed.
customer_reviews.author: MindyK

customer_reviews.title: Did not fit my 2018 Chevy Equinox.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for a 2018 Chevy Equinox, it said this fits your vehicle. Well NO they don't. If you trimmed them you to fit you would have to cut into the deep center totally defeating the purpose of it to hold water etc. Maybe they sent the wrong ones but decided to order higher priced ones that are supposed to fit. I did give it 2 stars because the did seem like a ok mat for the money if they fit.
customer_reviews.author: Michael D. Ames

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT fit a 2018 GMC Terrain
customer_reviews.text: I am so upset! This doesnt fit a 2018 Terrain. These are the ones you cut to fit so I put the 2 front mats in and after being cut it wasnt perfect but it worked. The problem is the back seats. I like that it came in one piece to cover the entire back but its wayyyy to long to fit. It can be cut to fit but you loose the middle coverage. So dissapointed! I wish I would have done the back first before I started cutting. I would have differently returned them, now I'm stuck with them.
customer_reviews.author: ivette padron

customer_reviews.title: Does need to be trimmed to fit but look great.
customer_reviews.text: Fit with trimming in my 01 sonoma 3 door extended cab 4x4. The rear mat was entirely too long but I cut one of the center sections out and trimmed the mats to fit. Front mats took minimal trimming on the drivers side but the transfer case hump on the passenger side did take some creative trimming to sit flat. The instructions said to use scissors but I used a pair of sheet metal snips. They seemed more precise for my needs. They look great and are a softer compound than my buddies higher end custom fit mats. All in all I'm happy with these in my part time work truck.
customer_reviews.author: William J Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Nice but too big for my rear seats
customer_reviews.text: I like these floor mats but I had to cut a lot to get them in place in the rear seats of my Nissan Juke. They're still too big so I need to cut around the lip and hopefully that will be small enough. But then I cut too much off the driver's side because it was last and I was tired of going back to cut more over and over. These are nice for the price if you aren't an idiot that cuts too much off.
customer_reviews.author: janet

customer_reviews.title: Keep them carpets clean
customer_reviews.text: After having to clean my carpets weekly I decided it was better to get some deep dish rubber mats, and since then I don't have to clean the carpets as often and they look nice. It is easy to cut with some patience you could trim them perfectly to the size of your vehicle to increase maximum protection. They clean easily and the small shopvac I have has no issues picking up the dirt. Whether it is kids or dogs this is a must have to protect the carpets in your car.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: great value, easy to customize
customer_reviews.text: I bought these from the overwhelming positive reviews. Not disappointed. I was looking for a floor mat set that had a complete rear seat mat, instead of the usual tiny individual mats that most sets provide. I thought that they were a little flimsy when I first took them out of the box, but I realized that they needed to be flexible in order to be able to trim them to fit different cars. They fit my 2014 Corolla very snug and it only took a few minutes to carefully cut out the segments that I didn't need. Hope they last for a while
customer_reviews.author: pizzabry

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend to everyone I know
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love these. I was torn at first based on the few neg reviews. But these are great. Look and hold up just as much as the expensive brand. Yes, you have to do a little cutting. But that was so simple. Jst place in your vehicle. Figure out where cuts need to be made, make a few, check again. Once perfect, just use that one as a guide for the other side. I did, in the back, have to cut out the middle piece. But I jsut laid it over the hump which has stayed put.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer S.

customer_reviews.title: overall a good purchase
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a 2011 ford focus and the fit isnt exact even with cutting. However, it is close enough that it wont bother me. The reason for 4 star is the claim of heavy duty. These things are extremely thin. The mats from the factory when I bought the car had a hole in it about 5 years after I bought the car from the boots I wear and due to shifting gears. I do believe these will eventually have the same issue. I have seen friends with the true custom made ones and they are 3 times thicker and very much embody their heavy duty claim.
customer_reviews.author: Rccolaman

customer_reviews.title: Not really fits my car but they are very good material
customer_reviews.text: So the 3 stars is because I don’t feel it really fits my Acura MDX 2007. I knew it was not going to be perfect but there are areas that really don’t fit well, specially in the back, so I just put my front seat a little bit over it so it will cover the flaws cause I don’t have time to return and I had already cut the front ones. Now, they do look like is a very good material and are exactly as pictured
customer_reviews.author: Yohanny Ballou

customer_reviews.title: they are ok and worth the price
customer_reviews.text: the rear floor mat is way to big for the rear floor board and there is not cutting it to fit .. so I just let it be. It works good enough but as for a fit to my 06 Avalanche (as approved by Amazon) .. that is a no. The fronts are better but they are also a wee bit large. Still they do that job and I hope that they last. I have seen others that are of more substance but are at least $100 more expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Mac Farlane

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised
customer_reviews.text: I think these mats are a great buy (they were $29.95 when I purchased them). Super easy to trim, although I didn't have to do a lot of that for my 2003 Ford Taurus. I haven't lived thru a messy Wisconsin winter with them yet, but I think they will do a good job. They are heavy and don't slide. Very nice inexpensive alternative to the pricey name brand we all see advertised. Highly recommended. Oh, and there is no odor to them at all.
customer_reviews.author: Mushy

customer_reviews.title: amazing quality and duribility
customer_reviews.text: price is unbelievable and cant be beat. durability and cut to fit is amazing. DO NOT BUY EXPENSIIVE NAME BRAND LASER MADE MATS.... THESE WILL IMPRESS YOU AND YOUR OCCUPANTS. IVE had these mats in all 4 vehicles I owe and never had to replace any of them. I keep a light coat of ARMOR ALL on all my mats for easy cleaning, and NO, my feet don't slip and slid. AGAIN BEST MONEY CAN BUY
customer_reviews.author: Randall S. Rogers

product_meta.title: Motor Trend MT-923-BK Black FlexTough Contour Liners-Deep Dish Heavy Duty Rubber Floor Mats for Car SUV Truck & Van-All Weather Protection
product_meta.description: Color:BlackFlexible and Tough - Flex Tough Tortoise series mats are designed to provide maximum protection. The uniquely constructed linear and diagonal ridges are placed strategically to maximize the dirt trapping capabilities of the mat. Made from only the highest quality polymers, Motor Trend Mats are Odorless and Non-Toxic. Trim able for Extra Customization. Deep Inverted Shell Design. No slip nibbed backing
feature_bullets: Flex Tough – Our Advanced Performance Rubber Polymers are Tested for Extreme Conditions to Ensure they Don't Crack, Split or Deform
No-Slip Grip – Rubberized Nibs on the Bottom so the Mat Does not Move – Ergonomic Grooves on Top to Give your Foot Traction & Comfort
Built for Protection – Guard Against Spills, or Debris – Built to Last through Rain, Snow, Mud and More
Designed for Compatibility – Made to be Trimble to Fit your Vehicle’s Floor Contours with only a Pair of Scissors
Please Check the Dimensions before Installation – Front (31.5" L x 22.5" W) Rear (58" L x 18" W)
Eco-Tech Products – Made from Odorless EVA Rubber & Approved by SGS European Standard ; HEPA

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars18,886 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
